sequence:
Lunar New Year!

<size=45>Chapter 3 - An Explosive New Year!</size>

scripts.say: Port - Dragon Empery Garden
...This thing... then put this here...
Alright, the firecracker is finished! I'm so good at crafting stuff!
F-Fu Shun, isn't that firecracker a little too big...?
That's no problem! The larger they are, the more fun they are! Okay, guys, step back a bit, I'll light the fuse!
Woohoo! Now witness the might of my specially made, extra large New Year's firecracker!
BOOOM!
W-what was that noise?! Was it you, Fu Shun?! I know you're up to something again!
Oh, crap, An Shan's here... Yikes, guys! I guess we shouldn't have used a whole barrel of gunpowder, ahaha...
Owww... Your firecrackers are scary, Fu Shun! ...I'm sorry, An Shan, I just couldn't stop her...
...Fu Shun! Get over here right now!
Owch... My head is spinning...
"Bang bang"... That sounded more like a bomb...
What's going on? Are we under attack?!
I heard a really loud bang so I came running here... Is everyone okay?
Huh? Laffey, what are you doing here? And what the hell was that noise?
The bang-bang firecracker Fu Shun made turned out to be a lot more powerful than we thought...
I'm so sorry, Enterprise and Lexington. My little sister must've alarmed you terribly... Fu Shun! Apologize with me, right now!
Sob... I'm sorry...
I'm just glad you weren't hurt... But still, a firecracker, huh... Usually, we only light those in celebration of a holiday...

Indeed, firecrackers are quite common during Lunar New Year... We have a legend about a monster named Nian Shou that's driven away by the sound of firecrackers. Although anyone could agree Fu Shun tried too hard...
I see, it's to drive away a monster, huh. Dragon Empery culture sounds pretty interesting.
Since Kimberly and Mullany just came here to learn how to cook, and you're here now too... why don't you stay and enjoy some of the food we made, as an apology of sorts...?
Oh, and if you'll wait a little, the commander and some others are gonna come too~
Uh, I don't think it warrants an apology. But... I'm curious what your cuisine is like, and it would be rude to refuse. What about you, Lexington?
I wouldn't mind either. We've never tried your cuisine before, so if anything you'll have to pardon us if we unknowingly do anything impolite.
